WorkItem.Summary: Fill in data to xls and save as pdf

Comments.Message:
Same problem. Have you been able to solve this? If yes please, tell me how. I think some files are missing.

:_(

Regards.

If you're using PDF, then you need to install your choice of PDF Renderer (in your case, looks like you've chosen DomPDF) separately..... PDF renderers do __not__ come bundled with PHPExcel...... you need to install DomPDF and then set `$rendererLibraryPath` to point to the filesystem path where you've installed that Renderer.
Thanks. It's already running (I had to rename a lot of classes in DomPDFLib/include but it finally works.

Hi ovj92,

The first thing is to download all necessary files in order to the library works. PHPExcel only brings "a kind of interface file" but doesn't bring all the necessary files. 

As far as I understand the style guide PHP, the file names must be built using the same name of the class is declared within. In the version of this library that I donwloaded, the files are different from those of the class containing names. Sometimes it was simply change capitalization in file names to match. 

I was using PHP with the Yii framework. I don't know how far Yii influenced the problem.

Let me know if you want the library that I edited and used. I can not send it here (7 MB). I can send my library (corrected by myself) to your mail if you want.

Please excuse my limited English (Â¿are you spaniard?). 

Regards.
